alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Greene; Eastern Schenectady; Eastern Ulster; Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Saratoga; Northern Warren; Schoharie; Southeast Warren; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer; Southern Saratoga; Western Albany; Western Greene; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 4:42PM EST until February 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Eastern New York including the southern Adirondacks, northern and eastern Catskills, Helderbergs, Mohawk Valley and Hudson Valley west of the river including Albany and Schenectady. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will greatly impact the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow total will be lowest near the Hudson River and highest over higher terrain in the Adirondacks, Helderbergs, and eastern Catskills. Snow rates will be heaviest from 9 pm this evening to 5 am Tuesday, when rates will range from 0.5 to 1.0 inches per hour.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
